discussion_comments.comment_body:
I might agree with extracting this as a shared config, but I’d prefer to handle it directly in the Next.js layout instead of introducing additional client components along the way. 

The function itself could live in a helper file (we’d need to decide which one), and then simply be called from the layout. 

Also, right now the page load doesn’t depend on the user, the user info is independent from the rendered components, is still that way?

Please don't add use client to any page in the app. We're using SSR capabilities from Next.js 14. There are no pages with use client in the entire project, so let's avoid introducing it.

For references: https://nextjs.org/docs/14/app/building-your-application/rendering
Hi, I dont know how to fix this. If I remove use client, the configured API keys and business context are not shown. Please let me know how to fix this.
